Context:
George Brown College implemented its Freedom of Expression policy on January 1, 2019. The policy is in line with the Colleges Ontario task force and applies to faculty, students, employees, and visitors. Complaints related to freedom of speech should be directed to George Brown Collegeâ€™s Office of Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights Services. Speech that constitutes harassment, threats or hate speech, and violates the Ontario Human Rights Code is not allowed. The policy works in conjunction with various college policies, including Academic Code of Conduct, Code of Student and Community Standards, Employee Codes of Conduct, Human Rights Discrimination and Harassment, and Use of College Facilities for Advocacy Purposes.
